ch.hszt.connectfour.model.board
Class GameBoard

java.lang.Object
  ch.hszt.connectfour.model.board.GameBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serial
public class GameBoard
extends java.lang.Object
implements Serial

Represents model-based game board independent of the realization of the user interface.

Version:
1.0, 11.10.2011
Author:
Markus Vetsch

Method Detail

getAll

public java.util.List<GameBoardSlotCollection> getAll()
Returns all relevant GameBoard elements (columns, rows, diagonals) represented by the list of GameBoardSlotCollection items.

Returns:
All relevant GameBoard elements.

getColumns

public java.util.List<GameBoardSlotCollection> getColumns()
Returns all columns of the GameBoard as list of GameBoardSlotCollection items.

Returns:
All the columns of the GameBoard as list of GameBoardSlotCollection items.

getRows

public java.util.List<GameBoardSlotCollection> getRows()
Returns all rows of the GameBoard as list of GameBoardSlotCollection items. Method is public for unit testing only !!!.

Returns:
All the rows of the GameBoard as list of GameBoardSlotCollection items.

getDiagonals

public java.util.List<GameBoardSlotCollection> getDiagonals()
Returns all valid (i.e. consisting of >= 4 GameBoardSlot) diagonals of the GameBoard as list of GameBoardSlotCollection items. Method is public for unit testing only !!!.

Returns:
All the columns of the GameBoard as list of GameBoardSlotCollection items.

insertDrop

public GameBoardSlot insertDrop(java.lang.String columnKey,
                                DropColor color)
Inserts a drop at specified column, if possible.

Parameters:
columnKey - - The column identifier, which the drop shall be set for.
color - - The DropColor of the drop.
Returns:
The affected GameBoardSlot, if the drop was successfully inserted; otherwise null is returned.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown, if either an invalid columnKey was passed as argument or if the associated column is already full and doesn't allow insertion of further drops.

reset

public void reset()
Resets the GameBoard into its original state, i.e. without any drops set.

getColumnById

GameBoardColumn getColumnById(int id)
Returns the corresponding GameBoardColumn by the id.

Parameters:
id - - The id of the GameBoardColumn.
Returns:
The associated GameBoardColumn or NULL, if no matching one found.

getColumnByKey

public GameBoardColumn getColumnByKey(java.lang.String columnName)
Returns the corresponding GameBoardColumn by the associated key.

Parameters:
columnName - - The key of the GameBoardColumn as String.
Returns:
The associated GameBoardColumn or NULL, if no matching one found.
